arguments.claim: The object of framing a charge as engrafted in the Code of Criminal Procedure is to give a clear idea of what the accused is being tried for and what are the essential facts he is required to meet in the trial

anchor.surface_text: The object of framing a charge as engrafted in the Code of Criminal Procedure is to give a clear idea of what the accused is being tried for and what are the essential facts he is required to meet in the trial.

arguments.claim: Unless and until the charge framed could be said to be such that the accused was misled or that such framing of charge has really caused any prejudice in the defence of the accused, the appellate court would not be justified in interfering with the conviction and sentence on the ground of so called defect in the framing of charge

anchor.surface_text: Having regard to the charges framed in this case, as shown at pages 5-6 of the paper book, and the impugned judgment of the Calcutta High Court, we have no hesitation in coming to the conclusion that the High Court was totally in error in setting aside the conviction and the sentence awarded by the Sessions Judge and in remitting the matter to the Sessions Judge for de novo trial.

holdings.text: Unless and until the charge framed could be said to be such that the accused was misled or that such framing of charge has really caused any prejudice in the defence of the accused, the appellate court would not be justified in interfering with the conviction and sentence on the ground of so called defect in the framing of charge.

anchor.surface_text: Unless and until the charge framed companyld be said to be such that the accused was misled or that such framing of charge has really caused any prejudice in the defence of the accused, the appellate companyrt would number be justified in interfering with the companyviction and sentence on the ground of so called defect in the framing of charge.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Object of framing charge under Code of Criminal Procedure is to give accused clear idea of accusation and essential facts required to meet; interference warranted only upon showing of actual misleading or prejudice to defence.

holdings.text: The decision relied upon by the learned A.S.G. squarely supports this conclusion of ours

anchor.surface_text: The decision relied upon by the learned A.S.G. squarely supports this conclusion of ours,
